sections.title: Books Received
paragraphs: Books listed below that are marked with a t have been selected for review in a future issue, and reviewers have been assigned to each.
Authors and publishers who wish their books to be considered for review in

sections.title: Computational Linguistics
paragraphs: should send a copy to the book review editor, Graeme Hirst, Department of Computer Science, University of Toronto, Toronto, Canada M5S 3G4. All books received will be listed, but not all can be reviewed. Technical reports will not be listed or reviewed.

Readers who wish to review books for the journal should contact the book review editor, outlining their qualifications, by writing to the address above or sending electronic mail to gh@cs.toronto.edu. Obviously, we cannot promise the availability of books in anyone's exact area of interest. Meta-logics and Logic Programming Krzysztof Apt and Franco Turini (editors) (University of Amsterdam and University of Pisa) Cambridge, MA: The MIT Press (Logic Programming Series, edited by Ehud Shapiro), 1995, xv + 339 pp; hardbound, ISBN 0-262-02252-2, $40.00 International Review of Sign Linguistics, Volume 1 William H. Edmondson and Ronnie B. Wilbur (editors) (University of Birmingham and Purdue University) Mahwah, NJ: Lawrence Erlbaum Associates, 1996, viii + 268 pp; ISSN 1082-7587; hardbound, ISBN 0-8058-1934-7, $59.95 ($36.00 prepaid) t Intelligent Language Tutors: Theory Shaping Technology V. Melissa Holland, Jonathan D. Kaplan, and Michelle R. Sams (editors) (U.S. Army Research Institute) Mahwah, NJ: Lawrence Ertbaum Associates, 1995, xviii + 384 pp; hardbound, ISBN 0-8058-1502-3, $79.95; paperbound, 0-8058-1503-1, $39.95 t Analogical Natural Language Processing Daniel Jones (UMIST) London: UCL Press (Studies in Computational Linguistics, edited by Harold Somers), 1996, xii + 155 pp; hardbound, ISBN 1-85728-218-3, £30.00 Syntactica (NeXTStep edition) Richard K. Larson, David S. Warren, Juliana Freire de Lima e Silva, and Konstantinos Sagonas (State University of New York, Stony Brook) Cambridge, MA: The MIT Press, 1996, x + 130 pp and 3.5-inch diskette for PCs and NeXTStations running NeXTStep 3.2 or higher; hardbound, ISBN 0-262-62106-1, $25.00 Using Speech Recognition Judith A. Markowitz Upper Saddle River, NJ: Prentice Hall PTR, 1996, xxii + 292 pp; paperbound, ISBN 0-13-186321-5, $34.00 Integration of Natural Language and Vision Processing, Volume II: Intelligent Multimedia Paul McKevitt (editor) (University of Sheffield) [Reprinted from

sections.title: Artificial Intelligence Review,
paragraphs: 9(2-3), 1995.] Dordrecht: Kluwer Academic Publishers, 1995, v + 170 pp; hardbound, ISBN 0-7923-3758-1, $66.00, £42.00, Dfl 98.00 Tense, Attitudes, and Scope Toshiyuki Ogihara (University of Washington) Dordrecht: Kluwer Academic Publishers (Studies in Linguistics and Philosophy, edited by Gennaro Chierchia, Pauline Jacobson, and Francis J. Pelletier, volume 58), 1996, xiv + 278 pp; hardbound, ISBN 0-7923-3801-4, $98.00, £63.00, Dfl 140.00 Scholarly Publishing: The Electronic Frontier Robin P. Peek and Gregory B. Newby (editors) (Simmons College and University of Illinois at Urbana-Champaign) Cambridge, MA: The MIT Press, 1995, xxii + 363 pp; hardbound, ISBN 0-262-16157-5, $35.00 Doing Worlds with Words: Formal Semantics Without Formal Metaphysics Jaroslav Peregrin (Charles University) Dordrecht: Kluwer Academic Publishers (Synthese Library, edited by Jaakko Hintikka, volume 253), 1995, xvi + 236 pp; ISBN 0-7923-3742-5, $97.00, £62.00, Dfl 145.00 452 Books Received The Generative Lexicon James Pustejovsky (Brandeis University) Cambridge, MA: The MIT Press, 1995, xii + 298 pp; hardbound, ISBN 0-262-16158-3, $35.00 Phrase Structure and the Lexicon Johan Rooryck and Laurie Zaring (editors) (University of Leiden and Macalester College) Dordrecht: Kluwer Academic Publishers (Studies in Natural Language and Linguistic Theory, edited by Liliane Haegeman, Joan Maling, and James McCloskey, volume 33), 1996, vii + 298 pp; hardbound, ISBN 0-7923-3745-X, $99.00, £75.00, Dfl 180.00 CSCL 95: Computer Support for Collaborative Learning [Proceedings of The First International Conference on Computer Support for Collaborative Learning, Bloomington, Indiana, 17-20 October 1995] John L.
